intro: Cremastosperma brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically forms dense mats of foliage, adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, often appearing in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are linear and succulent, helping to store water and reduce transpiration. Cremastosperma brevipes plays an important ecological role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
